rebel moon has rich visual storytelling the opening scene with the narrative of an empirical world who destroyed their planet and the tragedy that forced the loss of their monarchy teasing treachery and political intrigue and strife while introducing an indomitably cruel and sadistic minor antagonist who is but a pawn for the final villain antagonist directing things from the shadows is an ominous launching point for the story      the protragonist kora later to be revealed to be a girl in hiding by another name has an intricately complicated relationship with the final villain antagonist which only strengthens the plot surrounding her journey to gather individuals to her cause that could defeat this indomitable foe    her journey however begins on a planet as a simple farmer but we soon learn what she is and her intricate background soon reveals itself in narrative and action as well as her knowledge of how to deal with the newcomers to the planet veldt which to the imminent peril of the inhabitants of veldt is largely ignored     the history of the story at times is spoken in narratives to move the story along but this seems to be due to the time limits placed on the story which sits roughly at 2 hours and 16 minutes it could have been an 8 hour show filling with  expansive descriptive storytelling about the people the universe and the cultures    the actual narratives accompanied by flashbacks are rich with historical significance and recognizable symbolism and has all the action packed nuance of previous zack snyder works with well choreographed fight scenes that move the story in references to previous scenes and expansion of the influence of powers in the universe these action scenes also offer supplemental knowledge to the dialogue revealing strengths weaknesses and experience of characters that help you understand who they are where they came from and why they are there     this first installment is an incredible introduction into a rich and vibrant universe that has the potential to become more than just the story thats told and i look forward to future installments that continue to create a more vibrant painting of a universe its politics and its people who live within it    with incredible performances by sofia boutella star trek beyond the kingsman the secret service  djimon hounsou gladiator guardians of the galaxy a quiet place  part ii ray fisher justice league the piano lesson  anthony hopkins the silence of the lambs the father one life the mask of zorro and many more

gritty stunning builds a universe on the genius of star wars dune bladerunner et al  i cannot disagree with the critics on the concepts stolen but does this movie not combine the best of elements of the above  epic landscapes worlds dedicated to mining human nature at is worst greed and power and best  where it is unique is in not introducing jedi force magic like star wars therein lies the fantasy of childhood dreams   however we do have several magnificent samurai  who although they do not use magic are so incredibly talented that we are being led to believe that they alone can take a stand against a hugely powerful controlling empire like governance  the magnificent seven the samurai too were outnumbered but not outgunned  in this first movie the inspirational characters needed more development they needed to perhaps survive an attack and realize that they needed to split up and rally their own factions over time  the village is merely symbolic here its about the struggle against a cruel oppressive rule a fight for peace through autonomy a drive for fairness and respect in that respect it is or should not be the seven samurai sadly the closing scenes are the seven back on the original planet perhaps the second movie will see people and weapons flocking to the planet but somehow i doubt it sadly those super hero types will be held responsible for the defense rather than use their influence to gather support inspire resistance against the oppressor lead a truly sizeable force  but then will we criticize for copying star wars again easily done but unfair every historical battle has had its unequal sides but always had the weaker been able to take stands against the stronger  should the resistance in this movie franchise start a guerilla war  inflicting stings and retreating into the shadows or will we then criticize it for representing the futility of our own struggles against oppressive governments and controlling mega corporations  ultimately it may come over as a twee feel good movie based on the fantasy that a small number of skilled individuals can single handedly deliver us from tirany  i wish is the downfall of any review lets look at what we have consider the concepts the screenplay the cinematography the predictable script the heroes the obvious weak points in the oppressive regime and realize that those of us who hoped for an adult scifi have sadly been let down at least there wasnt a gun toting raccoon and small taking tree in this one  do we think the producers and directors had to fall foul of the modern movie scourge of general box office appeal  capitalism scores another nail in the coffin of individualism and uniqueness

rebel moon part 1 a child of fire  57  so from the get to i had mixed feelings about this movie it was okay it was not as bad as some or the internet portrayed it to be but it was by no means great it felt like a rushed edgier version of star wars the fight sceens were great that was the bread and butter but the actual character development and plot seemed extremely rushed for starters so the main plot the army needed to take over this planet to feed its entire army and then a gang of like 6 people were going to take on this army seemed very far fetched the twist was unexpected but it was also a character that i most liked so far so that caught me off guard overall it was worth the watch for the fight scenes and pure action alone but this movie is no second coming of star wars or any space saga  hopefully the second part will be alittle better and i will be there to check it out the robot ended up being my favorite character for what it is worth official sundaynightstreaming rating of 57

cringing in slow motion  this is a difficult movie to watch to the end the beginning the first 5 minutes is so absurdly bad that it feels like the film is a sarcastic parody of star wars but the narrative tone suggests otherwise it seems like a script that wants to be taken seriously but lacks a compelling story is verbose constantly overexplains itself with many loose ends in the plot caricatured characters lacking charisma and clichés the cinematography is poor the choice of lenses is subpar with characters participating in a scene appearing out of focus or blurred always always slow motion cheesy soundtrack this is bad in everyway

this movie is so bad i actually got a rotten tomatoes account so i could tell everyone how bad this is    some people say quite generously i think this is a space opera in the vein of the seven samurai    that is an insult to at least six of the seven samurai    this is more like a over cgd version of battle beyond the stars which in itself was a poor copy of the seven samurai but at least the characters were well developed    rotten tomates is making me rate this movie by the use of stars    i gave it a half a star but if it were up to me i would give it half of a protostar    to be honest much like a plate of brussel sprouts i couldnt finish watching the movie but i had eaten enough to know it had a terrible taste and needed a couple glasses of something to force it down my gullet    they could have reformed alex in the movie a clockwork orange by making him watch this instead of ultraviolence    could have cured him in half the time imho    when part ii comes out please find something less painful to do like have a fullyclawed cat high on catnip check your head for lice i dunno

honestly based on the reviews i initially anticipated this film to be nearly unwatchable however when my wife and i decided to give it a chance we were pleasantly surprised    while the film introduces viewers to a rich and expansive new universe with intricate characters and deep motivations it is not without its flaws the main issue lies in its duration as it undeniably needed an extra hour or more    the pacing feels rushed and if the intention was to encourage viewers to watch the extended cut it would leave me feeling somewhat deceived    i find myself wishing this were a series rather than a film allowing each character the opportunity to shine with a longer runtime from the start this could potentially evolve into a new cult classic and the decision not to provide it with ample time was a significant oversight

epic space fantasy incredible representation of other worlds a wonderful escape from  well my daily life     i dont agree with the movie critics who appear too hung up with derivative references to other movies and consequently and imho inappropriately rating movies down i have worked for many years with professional music recordings and quite frankly everything is derivative  and it is of little relevance this movie was an epic emotional and experiential escape  and yes it is a movie  and not a tv series like star wars andor where the time for solid character development is readily available nevertheless it was easy to connect and empathise with the salient protagonists against the nazilike galactic regime and enjoy the journey and vision delivered in rebel moon

have to admit it this way i actually loved this film i know some negative reviews are trying to be harshly against the film because it was inspired by seven samurai and most other types of films but honestly which other films havent been that way before this however is definitely not a ripoff of star wars at all it is a completely different story compared to star wars it appears such expectations were too high with not enough open minds to take it all in differently at least i went into this film just open minded lowering my expectations without nit picking on parts of it like i used to because i enjoyed this for what it is and thats that its only a story to setup more happening in part 2 which made total sense rebel moon part 2 the scargiver needs to hurry up though because it will truly explain a lot more and go deeper this is part 1 after all its a twoparter type of film and patience is the key to slowpaced films like this hopefully more installments take place after

fantastic from beginning to end

i cant believe how astounding this movie is and yet how many bad reviews it has received it does follow the seven samuraithe magnificent seven set up i love how it has that spaghetti western grittiness to it but that it also has a slower pace in storytelling watching this movie made me feel like i was reading a good novel the flashes of reveals in koras past the mystery over who killed the royal family the glimpses of how the imperium does things it is so rich in cultures in its storybased universe    i will say now that i am a huge star wars fan and i am happy to see another space opera coming out so others comparing it to star wars and are angry that it is not star wars need to chill this is a different story     the cgi is smooth and enjoyed seeing the styles of the spaceships i am so happy to see a griffin loved that part and loved the fight scenes  kora can kick serious butt    but anyway despite what the haters say rebel moon is a good movie with plenty of intrigue lots of fights and its story has a beginning middle and an end that promises continuance into movie 2 yes the plot is familiar because it is a scifi version of the seven samurai yes we know what is going to happen next but i simple cant wait for part 2 and see what other twists zack synder comes up with

rebel moon part 1 has some good visuals and passable performances from the cast there was also a clear attempt to take the worldbuilding seriously which i appreciate and it didnt go down the marvel route of forcing inane jokes and zaniness on the audience every ten seconds in case boredom sets in these desperate attempts at humour are often the most boring part however thats all the praise i can give the film wouldve benefited a lot if the characters had more presence and personality as few of them stood out as memorable at one point theres a supposedly emotional moment where one of the good guys heroically sacrifices himself but it has little impact given that we know nothing about him and his personality is 100 interchangeable with several other characters  the story feel formulaic at times  go to planet recruit another hero dump some exposition rinse repeat  and theres nothing in the plot you wont have seen at least a hundred times before so this movie doesnt have anything that marks it out as excellent but it passes the time amiably enough if you dont expect too much from it

lets not forget this was originally pitched as a star wars movie so move past the obvious parallels and see it for what it is yes its obviously derivative reread my previous sentence but its an impressive attempt to move beyond being rejected by the franchise and carry on regardless and sofia boutella is absolutely awesome in it yes the empire have been replaced by half arsed nazi knockoffs and the back story is never adequately explained but the action set pieces are really well executed i really dont get the complaints about the amount of exposition i cant say i noticed it being particularly dry and if youre world building some context is necessary there are some ropey characters that let it down a bit but overall this was enjoyable and the trailer for part 2 looks even better

i think the movie delivers what it promised the story in this first part of rebel moon is somewhat shallow but filled with good intentions anime and science fiction enthusiasts will be thrilled by the breathtaking scenes    the visuals truly captivate offering a feast for the eyes the characters while not deeply explored in this installment show potential for growth and complexity in future parts of the series the film successfully captures the essence of both anime and scifi genres creating a visually stunning experience that resonates with fans    however a more intricate plot development could enhance the overall storytelling despite its current simplicity the film sets the stage for potential expansion in subsequent installments the combination of stunning visuals and the promise of deeper narratives leaves audiences eager for what comes next in the rebel moon series

visually striking and powerful the world building and introduction to all of the characters and their unique personalities abilities and pasts was perfect meanwhile also telling and moving through the story the pacing was very smooth     the creatures as they travelled to the different moons in search of other rebels were intense beautiful and one of them rather spine chilling at first glance harmada but in a way i also felt for her too to be scared but also sympathize is something the directions did very well here     i have to admit my favourite scene was a beautiful moment that made me tear up between jimmy and sam by the river when he was telling her about princess issa how she reminded him of her and you could see how broken he was that he was not able to protect issa in the way he was programmed to as she was killed the way sam sat completely immersed in what he was saying but also making a flower crown from daisies and placed them on his head it melted something inside of him she showed him warmth and kindness and i think in the future films  film he will be sams biggest protector     a really beautiful and visually dazzling movie filled with action but also holds these delicate moments where you really fall in love with the characters

the film solely featuring aesthetically pleasing and hence sometimes uninteresting actors encounters challenges in its direction the execution falls short with issues in blocking and timing affecting the overall cinematic experience the narrative setup lacks the necessary differentiation and depth rendering it somewhat simplistic and naive the portrayal of culture appears to be approached with a somewhat idealized perspective resulting in a cookiecutter representation furthermore the characters unfortunately come across as onedimensional and predictable    one is left pondering the significant craftsmanship and time invested in the creation of the story however the absence of a robust foundation in worldbuilding and emotional relatability diminishes the impact of these efforts a more comprehensive exploration of these aspects could have elevated the overall quality of the film    regrettably due to the aforementioned shortcomings i found it challenging to immerse myself fully in the film ultimately leading to an incomplete viewing experience
it was goodgreat story and good visualsi think it deserves better critics thats why im ranking it 45

some of the character development is a bitrushed but this feverdream mismash of  scifi is pretty and engrossing  the character development is a bit rushed but the general flow of ideas and worldbuilding is pretty spot on  i would like to see both the directors cut and second part of this series and will recommend it to my friends    upon a bunch of further introspection i think i get why this movie is so divisive  i think perhaps the professional critics and a fair bunch of the nonprofessionals are pretty uninspired by this film because they want to take it as an individual piece of art and a complete work  this is the new normal where a production house can take ten or twenty hours to deliver a story that once had to be encapsulated in 120 minutes or less    this has to be viewed through the lens knowing that this film is only the first part of the narrative and a truncated version at that  when you only get to see the first act you only get exposition and not the character development or building that will happen in the second act and the full heros journey wont complete until the third    i think the reviewers here that think this movie is great are viewing with this episodic lens  i know that watching this i know that there are further episodes coming and i am curious to see how the story develops and what ideas will be presented later on  i am also anxious to see the full release of this episode later as this will also reveal the true vision of this first act hidden here by the pg13 rating requirements

we are in luck because of the dazzling visuals very nice it is also the only thing that kept me watching since the plot is so focking bad its like a speed run for the most clichés in 1 movie this feels like a collection of every storytelling aspect i hate characters are given personalities that are totally not explored and feel very unnecessary running through the story and leaving immersion and depth at the side the plot could be so much easier but they made it complicated wich is not a problem but please do enlighten us with the complexity of your universe and story it feels like skipping from branch to branch   bad cliché but nice cgi

not sure where to start the story screenplay acting  characters all seem horrendously shallow cheesy and cringe its basically a kids films story with a pg13 theme which underdelivers and therefore isnt one or the other as the depth feels extremely watered down they planet hop to spend 15 minutes on a supposedly secondary character for them to only have 3 more lines for the rest of the film there are times where i dont think the main characters speak for extended periods of time i liked the world building around the current story the flashbacks and the aesthetics but everything else is a huge miss even the action feels janky and stupid with their huge lean on slow motion i have no idea how they were comfortable publishing this the reason id watch the second one is to see how much worse that is

more effort was placed into making this film look pretty than anything else defend your settlement from raiders  fallout 4 go on a quest to gather a host to defend your settlement  dd a bug story throw in a forgettable cast a slice of every scifi ip out there and you have this movie also    i am pretty sure this movie is taking a big ol dump on warhammer 40k in hope of putting a negative light on the franchise belisarius mechanicum reaally i am expecting to see spacemarines the inquisition and titans in the next chapter     my eyes were exhausted and i got vertigo from all the eyerolling and cringe pretty but dumb so pretty dumb

the visual effects were superb throughout with compelling characters and outstanding performances especially cara the plot and setting reminds you of several universes but it never detracted from the viewing experience i thought one scene at the trading city bar was reminiscent of the star wars cantina but that was the only blatant borrowing i saw obviously it is about a group of rebels that rebel against an empire so you can see some of the parallels to star wars i also felt it had some homage to dune and chronicles of riddick the movie plays quickly at 215 i never felt it dragged and let me just say there is a twist near the end that surprised me and something unexpected i understand this is a multipart series so hopefully it will develop a following if you love scifi give it a chance and enjoy it for what it is and do not try to overanalyze it

rebelmoon pg13 cómo película cumple todas las expectativas es entretenida tiene muy buena acción buen vfx hermosa cinematografía y un excelente score una problemática bastante relacionable y con una historia facil de seguir   esta versión abarca lo suficiente en cuanto historia y desarrollo para introducirnos a este universo y a estos personajes y justamente al mostrar solo lo suficiente para comprender la trama y personajes te hace querer conocer y ver mas dándole a la audiencia el ideal de seguir enganchado y querer ver la parte dos de esta historia y el futuro corte del director para indagar en el pasado de los rebeldes y en el trasfondo de la historia aún mejor rebel moon va directo al punto una dinámica que se puede percibir tal vez apresurada pero para lo que intenta ser esta versión lo logra muy bien una introducción épica pero sencilla al público a un nuevo universo     rebelmoon as a pg13 movie meets all expectations it is entertaining it has very good action good vfx beautiful cinematography and an excellent score a very relatable issue with an easy to follow story  this version covers enough history and development to introduce us to this universe and these characters and precisely by showing just enough to understand the plot and characters it makes you want to know and see more giving the audience the ideal of staying hooked and wanting to see part two of this story and the future directors cut to delve into the rebels past and the background of the story even better rebel moon gets straight to the point a dynamic that can perhaps be perceived as rushed but for what this version tries to be it achieves it very well an epic but simple introduction for the audience to a new universe

zack snyders rebel moon catapults audiences into an expansive galactic odyssey that blends dazzling visuals with an intriguing narrative as a fan of snyders distinctive style i eagerly delved into this space epic snyders signature visual flair is evident in every frame elevating the movie to a cinematic spectacle a child of fire serves as the inaugural installment in a series of adventures one notable aspect is its ambitious attempt to construct a comprehensive universe however its drawback lies in the challenge of functioning seamlessly as a standalone movie the films emphasis on universebuilding while commendable may hinder its effectiveness as an independent cinematic experience

i can see why the top critics panned this film i nearly gave up after the first few minutes as it looked like it would be a weak low budget boring affair but how wrong i was once the characters are introduced and developed over the first part of the film the pace slowly ramps up and up and i got carried along on what is an exciting ride with great characters as good as those in the super hero movies and you could almost see this film in manga form with its style and action sequences im glad i stayed the distance and cant wait for part 2 already dont believe the downbeat critic reviews which whilst understandable from the first few minutes i think are disappointed its a fairly simple premise like star wars was lol a fabulous film but at its core good vs bad albeit done with incredible mastery by all concerned give rebel moon a chance i dont think youll be disappointed and maybe youll love it as much as i do bring it on

rating says meh it passed the time but it felt like i wasted my time nice visuals and makeup the plot and pacing though were ridiculous  more like watching various cutscenes from an epic video game and with similar plot jumps  go here collect character build party have fight  pass trial and absolutely no context  the spider thing continue on almost zero character development beyond the main character     spoiler  got to the last big scene  fight of the movie and i thought wait this isnt the end of the movie already they basically got tricked to land at the equivalent of a warehouse loading bay andoh the big bad is here uh tension capture escape fight explosions loss of importantbutnotreally character reflect on challenges overcome oh and apparently a fivestory space warship can be crashed by flicking a single switch from the gunners chair  sp off    check that i cant even give it two stars the more i think back    if you completely check your brain at the door or like to download and watch fancy scifi screensavers then you might get 2 hours of entertainment out of this    just pass on it until the full cut is released next year  maybe that will be worth it

overall an enjoyable film though it is a bit derivative and is strangely paced the main set pieces are very watchable and have some interesting visual touches theres a lot going on and it seems that it would have been better as a miniseries with time to flesh out each of the characters the general structure of the seven samurai is to spend time building up the characters of the supporting squad so that their eventual deaths are meaningful here we spent a little too much time on the bad guys and search for the squad rather than on the squad themselves  thus we really dont care enough about the crew perhaps that work will be done in part two    in any case the visuals and action were enough diversion for a few hours

firstly in terms of the rating i think 710 is more precise and reasonable not sure how ppl are giving it a 15 or anything around or less than that fractionally those reviews to me seem driven by some peculiar emotional mix worst movie or things of that sort i sense are written by folks that either dont watch many films had a bad day or dont know how to assess films like this  now to the movie its a hodgepodge of parts of other cinematic ip which is not a novel notion considering the director openly stated that it was pitched as a star wars spinoff cant quite tell if it feels more like star wars dune or at times a western but for sure it doesnt feel too original the dialogue is ok i was expecting morebetter however the acting is stellar the cast picks up for any slack and so it seems appropriate and relevant to identify that and take it into account with gradation its worth noting the movie has its share of puzzles it never quite places and side persons i feel it should invest more time in expanding on film is littered with a lot of interesting pictorial angles   act 2 is best imo  if youre looking for space fighting aesthetic grandeur and a decent plot this is for you  perhaps the sequel will build better on the things missed but the movie is a good watch

meh as yogi berra said its like deja vu all over again while it had high production values and fine acting the plot seemed unremarkable familiar derivative  mainly of star wars even the blasters make the same beeyoobeeyoobeeyoo sound  about every 20 minutes id raise the remote to switch away  right then a kickbutt fight would erupt so id stay eventually raise the remote another fight  warcraft uses the same trick to keep players playing the main character kora sofia bouttela is believably intense athletic and can kick the horns off 8 charging rhinos the antagonist nobel ed skrein is suitably sociopathic in his role as an admiral of a too naziesque strike force from the motherworld he plans to extract one harvest from the farming world kora is on and then wipe out the population  an idea that makes no economic sense  but galvanizes kora to assemble a ragtag army of rebels  this whole heros journey has been done a billion times before you can tell where this story is going the moment you lay eyes on kora fitting into her adopted farming village like riddick into an allgirls kindergarten class the plot is like muzak where the tune is familiar but the highs and low have been taken out

1 it is supposed to be a movie show dont tell it is just so laboriously slow with an intro of seemingly endless narration    2 a good movie is more than a collection of action scenes strung together with monologues and narration    lots of interesting concepts but not put to good use plot makes very little sense  for example the evil empire is evil for the sake of being evil    evil empire hey we can sellgive you farming robots so you can have massive yields  farmers naw we want to work by hand we are just a tiny farming community on this planet and dont exactly grow much food    a semiintelligent evil empire would say okay cool then take their farming robots and farm the hell out of a different part of the planet to get the food they need maybe offering to pay for some time with their master gardener    but nope instead they kill a couple people and drop off their most sadistic troops to ensure their plan goes to hell in a hand basket right away protagonists cant be chronically stupid and yet have a track record of amazing competence    it simply isnt very good

think bugs life as a space opera with aliens and humans   big bad guys come to take the annual harvest   threaten to hurt everyone if they do not provide a full harvest   one of the farmers takes on the role of finding even meaner bugs people to fight the bad guys away from their farming community   sword wielding ninja mercenary named nemesis   bad han solo owns a ship   roman themes throughout  including a general or two   a displaced prince who can speak to fantastic beasts and apparently can handle the massive thermal changes without ever wearing a shirt but he needs pants   a bad guy who is killed and then restored to life with a new mission to bring back the kidnappedadopted daughter of thanos wait no but kind of      aside from the thin veil of plagiarism the special effects are pretty good the story telling is subpar i watched this because it got great reviews i see that i was maliciously misinformed

it has an ok start to it although the accents of the bad soldiers was a bit on the nose    then it turns into seven space samurai but unlike the original where you understand what theyre doing and why its a lot more ambiguous here in the original you understand what both sides want and how they plan on achieving it     in the original its a village full of people guided by the ronin in a defensible position they are against a gang of bandits this is a winnable fight    in seven go to space theyre defending a village against the equivalent of the empire in star wars the second they encounter hardship they could just destroy the village or the entire planet our heroes even seem to acknowledge this but still dont seem to have any kind of plan beyond join forces and defend the village    so after they leave the village pretty early in the movie its just a recruitment drive we go to next guy and collect for team we have no plan its shockingly boring

as i watched rebel moon part 1 i couldnt help but feel disappointed by what unfolded on the screen the film which promised an exciting scifi adventure was marred by a series of critical flaws firstly the script was a letdown filled with clichés and lacking in meaningful character development this made it hard for me to connect with or even care about the characters and their journey additionally the pacing was painfully slow with numerous scenes dragging on without adding anything significant to the story although the visual effects were technically impressive they often felt excessive and seemed to compensate for the lack of a strong narrative the performances too left much to be desired failing to bring any real depth or nuance to the lackluster script all these elements combined made rebel moon part 1 a forgettable and rather frustrating viewing experience falling short of the captivating scifi epic it aimed to be

this is an objectively terrible movie that said it is a really fun drinking game movie get a group of family or friends and have a drink everytime you spot a scene character or storyline ripped from another movie if you know your scifi and fantasy movies you will be quite drunk by the end     i am frankly quite amazed a second instalment is imminent the acting was very poor the effects were ok some effects were terrible the characters were ridiculous and the story line wholly unoriginal as a new cast member came on screen an asian lady we took bets on whether or not she was going to be a ninja sure enough asian lady is a ninja with lightsabers     skip this movie unless you watch it is a group for some drinking fun

really enjoyed it obviously going to get comparisons to star wars not a massive star wars fan but enjoyed the style and goresomewhat that i always thought star wars should have   i will say the main character is pretty terrible not a great cast whatsoever incredibly boring and shes genuinely just not a great actor but would have rather have her than the a cringe john boyega cutting about my screen   this film has been somewhat panned  from reading the reviews if this film had star wars attached to its title it would be clearing 4 out of 5s easily from most reviewers also people love jump on a hate train  zack synder is victim to this most of the time big man should change his name and hed be getting decent reviews   but aye if youre reading this and youre on the fence give it a bash its a good watch for sure

33 minutes into movie and nothing grabs my attention boring slow cant get intimate the characters pass

thoughtless mind numbing trash it feels weird to say a movie both has way too much exposition and at the same time absolutely none the viewer is spoon fed melodramatic flashback scenes of over delivered dialogue to establish the main characters tragic trope of a back story while every other character is given a short segment of an over the top action sequence and some crumbs of dialogue only to take up arms and join the party without any meaning or reason then getting shoved off screen exit stage right    scifi fans will quickly realize that everything put on screen by the design department is something theyve seen done before from costumes that look directly ripped out of other franchises to weapons so uninspired and unoriginal your brain will be convinced they pulled them off another set     backgrounds often appear as flat wide open poorly rendered cgi spaces that serve to remind your brain that nothing on screen is real and none of this matters the special effects look like mid 2000s video game cutscenes that seem intentionally blurred to hide the mistakes    nobody will be talking about this movie a month from now and if theres any justice in the world this flop will serve as a reminder to future scifi writers and directors that if you want to start your own ip you have to be at least somewhat original

this movie can only be reviewed with a pros and cons list as the polarity of what was good and what was bad was so dramatic i feel the need to break it up     pros  the graphic design of this movie is unbelievably good whomever designed the worlds and graphically created them did one of the best jobs i have ever seen the work they did into making the worlds feel so realistic were phenomenal i was beyond impressed this maybe some of the best imagery i have ever seen in a movie ever 10 stars  the movie soundtrack has a very well balanced epic nature to it and felt very dramatic but still felt smoothly placed along the different scenes of the movie   4 stars    cons    the main female actress was not good her acting was atrocious what really ruined it for me is that it is an action movie it was abundantly obvious that she had zero athletic ability even her run looked non athletic it was weird and made it very hard to take her serious in the action scenes triple camera angles bouncing around and slow motion scenes for days to make up for her inability to do any real action choreography also this actress is like 90lbs i very much doubt shes able to do any hand to hand combat yet they kept putting her in scenes where she is   5 stars   plot armormore plot armorandwell more plot armor i am convinced that a 10 year old wrote this plot line it just does not have one real piece of developed plot it was beyond cliche there were no surprises everything was obvious and half the time the plot made no sense the collecting warriors montage was so dumbi almost turned the movie off on the gryphon scene i love gryphons but there was no need to add this part to the movie other than to attract that small portion of sub 80 iq viewers  5 stars  acting almost every major actor in the movie besides the main actress who is horrible are usually really good actorsactresses it hurt my heart to see some of my most favorite actors and actresses going through the motions as they participated in this horrendously bad movie you could feel that they just were not in it i recognize i know next to nothing about directing a movie and at this point i am 100 certain i could make a better film this is absolutely painful to watch   5 stars    conclusion  this movie is absolutely horrible what makes this movie even more terrible is the fact that the creators of the imagery and music did a beyond well done job only to have all their hard work just flushed right down the toilet with terrible writingdirecting this movie had some amazing potential and could have rocked the socks off of any viewer but the never ending plot holes the terrible acting the unrealistic and mediocre main protoganist the sidelined better actorsactresses and the cliche ending were absolutely deflating the producerswritersdirectors should be ashamed of themselves

this film stands as a profound disappointment a stark contrast to the expectations set by its promising premise its plagued by a multitude of shortcomings the most glaring of which is its poorly structured plot the storyline meanders without clear direction leaving the audience bewildered and disengaged the script is another weak point filled with dialogue that feels artificial and forced further detracting from the movies potential to resonate with its viewers    in terms of performances the actors seem to struggle unable to breathe life into their onedimensional characters this lack of depth in character development results in a failure to evoke any emotional investment from the audience the interactions between characters feel stilted and unnatural exacerbating the films overall lack of cohesion    furthermore the direction of the movie is lackluster its evident that theres a missing sense of vision or creative flair which leaves the film feeling uninspired and tedious this is compounded by the subpar cinematography and special effects which are neither innovative nor particularly wellexecuted instead of enhancing the storytelling they feel like afterthoughts failing to add any real excitement or visual appeal    even the soundtrack which often serves as a redeeming feature in many films is unremarkable and forgettable in this case it neither complements the scenes nor adds any additional layers to the narrative    overall the movie is a significant letdown it fails to deliver on many fronts from storytelling and character development to technical aspects like cinematography and special effects the end result is a film that is not only unsatisfying but also forgettable lacking the elements necessary to make it a worthwhile cinematic experience

this movie had so much potential but ultimately fell flat im optimistic for the sequel because it is an interesting world to create a compelling story in and all the pieces are there it just comes down to the actual story and the development of the characters     my primary issues are koras character development being done entirely in voice over flashbacks which messed up the pacing of the movie the complete lack of characterization of everyone on the elite team they gathered and the climax taking place at an unnamed undisclosed trade depot which drastically reduced the stakes of protecting the farm planet the primary conflict was based around    the biggest positive was kai the acting was spot on the costume choice and props he had made him intriguing and i dont want to spoil anything but his twist had a good set up and payoff    i hope the sequel is better because i really believe it can be good

i truly had high hopes for this film and its sequel but i am sad to say i was severely underwhelmed and disappointed by this attempt at a space opera of sorts  first the visuals while elaborate and meant to be eye candy were ruined by poor decisions such as zack snyders continuous use of slow motion throughout the film all the major battlesaction packed moments were ruined by ridiculous slow motion cuts  the characters were really hard to get to know and almost there to just create an ensemble of rebels yet you barely get to know anything about them the movie was slow yet jumped quickly from location to location in an effort to fit in as much as possible in the short window of time the movie was allotted  sadly i went into this movie with zero idea of what it was about and was open to just enjoy another star wars like film and i hate to say how utterly disappointed i was  there was basically nothing redeeming about this film and unfortunately it rewatchability is basically zero  not sure how part 2 can rescue the mess caused by one

a movie that was 30 substance 70 vfx an ensamble reminiscent of star wars lord of the rings and dune with about half the heart     the movie has beautiful environments that werent explored with the characters being the same poor back stories and a rushed premise give a lack luster feeling leaving you with wanting more in a half satisfied way   this movie was hoping to capture hearts through visuals only to flood the screen with them the plot villains and supporting cast were all a copy paste of preexisting universes just with extra steps the movie feels like another expensive flop where unhinged coked up producers wanted to shove something down our throat with the monomer of biggest movie of the year when can we get another movie that loves us when can we get that fluttering feeling similar to that of harry bidding farewell to his son luke saving the galaxy or frodo growing old where is the sense of a long adventure coming to an end where you crave no more where our story telling appetite has been satiated     the movie was visually amazing stunning no thrilling also no but if youre looking for a movie that will make you reach the bottom of the popcorn bucket get up off your seat and get a refill mid movie this is it startle up for a modern time b movie with a larger budget than it deserved trending the flops of 2023 this movie will leave you not wanting more of it part 2 in april 2024 yeah ill leave that one in the queue for a while

in a nutshell what if seven samurai was playing star wars in fireflys house while wearing a warhammer 40k outfit but with no character development       the good   visually its amazing costuming props fight choreography  lighting and cinematography are all top notch    the bad   the plot is a paint by numbers gather the team which would be fine if they gave us a reason to care about any member of said team  theres zero character development unless youd consider a few exposition heavy flashbacks for the main character development id have listed the cast among the good since from other work i know them to be talented but the script here gives them so little to work with you wouldnt know it the dialog feels stilted at the best of times and like theyre just dumping info on the audience at the worst rebel moon rushes the viewer from big action set piece to big action set piece never stopping to let us get to know a character beyond look they can do this cool fighty thing worst of all the big twist betrayal is so forced that its practically telegraphed before the character who does it even joins the group     theres supposed to be a directors cut to come later so maaaaaaaybe the character development was left on the cutting room floor but unless theyre adding another full two hours i highly doubt it

im a big scififantasy fan but boy was this movie absolutely garbage     its like they tried to use a firefly type vibe to try to cross lord of the rings and star wars sprinkle in some dune and warhammer 40k and there you go the hot mess that is rebel moon part 1 they can go ahead and not bother with part 2     the gratuitous use of slow motion in action scenes and long voice overs to explain the storyline only sour an already suboptimal offering i give a lot of scifi movies the benefit of the doubt typically saying great concept poor execution but even the concept here was so convoluted and derivative that even a good execution probably wouldnt have made up for it

i sat down excited for this movie it had a lot of hype that hype fell flat i watched the entire thing though i did stop it 34 of the way through when movies especially of the action variety are at their most exciting i opted to go do some random work instead i then returned to the movie but only to see  how the train wreck ended saying it borrows a lot from other sci fi is an understatement it also borrows from fantasy as well which just makes the world building muddled at best the pacing is horrible and too much info is left out leaving you to almost have to do some absurd mad libs in your head none of the characters seem to mesh together organically either if i fully had to describe this movie to someone i would tell them that someone filmed a little kid pretending to play star wars with his toys except for none of the toys are from matching series plus all the toys arent legitimate licensed toys buy stuff youd get off wish  i will probably watch the r rated version when it drops to see if any coherency is added but i doubt it

im going to have to agree with most neh sayers here over hyped junk waste of my time the slow mo in 300 was at least well positioned and followed the right places at the right times but in this movie it felt like someone threw darts at the story board in order to decide where and when the slow motion action was to happen so many stolen seens from star wars blade runner harry potter the matrix to name a few so no originality here either the only reason i gave it 15 stars is because i have a large 100 inch screen which made parts of it watchable the dialogue was very weak and getting the team together was laim if you know the famous western the magnificent seven it is the same but weaker less charisma from each character also wtf we never got to see the general fight

zack snyders directing is that of a child playing with action figures    generic plot barebone characters just uninteresting filler to get to the action sequences  the action sequences themselves are filled with childish cool explosions and almost entirely slowmo    entire movie gathers up these legendary characters that literally do nothing say nothing have zero personality no crew dynamics or interactions all for the buildup to this final battle that doesnt even happen    even the main antagonists and their ship are built up to be this unstoppable force of destruction on paper but i swear even a gentle fart in the wind could have taken everything down    waste of 2 hours unless you really love lensflares in which case you should go watch star trek instead

rebel moon part one is cinematographically stunning but narratively bereft you are introduced to an arguably bloated ensemble of characters for whom you feel next to nothing because none of their stories are explored properly and to make matters worse nearly every scrap of backstory that is successfully purveyed to the viewer is delivered through a series of dreary monologues the nail in the coffin for rebel moon is the story itself which is not so much a story as it is a series of hastily gluedtogether scifi tropes from other far more competent films in the genre all in all it is a beautiful and bland appetizer for the remaining installments and i am not confident many will be interested in the next course

personally i believe this movie to be a great scifi action movie although many see a substantial amount of problem with the movie lets discuss first off the intro to this movie is slow and the grabbing of sand to smell is off putting to put the least not a great start although many of the fight scenes are amazingly choreographed and the visual effects make a spectacle of a movie this is not enough to carry a movie alone the story telling is a tough subject many thematic choices and the fact this is a two part story limit the first film to as set up for the second meeting characters historys  so on which i didnt see as much a problem biggest concern being the lack of use of many of these characters in the unexpected final fight scene i wanted to see the farmer fight in the fields and the robot was barely in the film although i chalk most of this up as movie prep for the second film overall i genuinely enjoyed this film and would recommend when the second releases its half a story and im treating it as such its like stopping a movie half way through its unsatisfying ultimately im excited for the rest

have you ever read steven erikssons malazan book of the fallen bookseries its an epic highfantasy series well worth the read but its always been kinda lovehate due to its complexity and unwillingness to hold the reader by hisher hand the story told in the series takes place in a world with hundreds of thousands of years of history and context and for lack of a better metaphor basically throws the reader into the deep end of the pool to sink or swim those of us that learned to swim learned to love the books the ones who drowned not so much    the books work in part because they build and present strong and memorable characters that can drive the story and keep it coherent when the context is missing this takes time effort and a clever pen but eriksson lives up to the challenge and the series is well hailed as one of the great ones    this movie made me think of eriksson this i think is how a movie would look if someone decided to make an erikssoninspired film with deep lore and lots of complexity and context but forgot about the part where they also needed strong and believable characters to drive the story forwards because they most assuredly did forget about the need for believable characters that is    dont get me wrong the characters are strong any and all of em seems capable of taking out an entire platoon of soldiers at any given time at least until the plotarmour weakens that sadly does not mean that the characters are believable or able to carry the films lacking scrip or pacing because the movie is sadly underwritten in this regard the scrips consist of people talking  at  each other often in an unintended parodically manner not people talking  to each other in any meaningful way and the pacing is not just lacking its plain gone often we are forced to witness a moreorless random scene where people  who have just met and doesnt know each other  tell of the most intimate things in order to either establish some sort of tragic background or to make us believe that this is a sort of bonding moment between the characters to say that its unbelievable is an understatement    in sum we are left with a bunch of stereotypical archetypes  an assassin a rebel a misunderstood and most likely unfairly judged traitor the mandatory actual traitor the tragic general a prince and a few others i can remember just now they are all honourable have a stereotypical trait or two and are willing to take up the fight with the evil overlords who conveniently dress talks and acts like nazis random violence and torture included so that the storyline can soldier on this is not the way to build or present your characters this is not the way to tell a complex story or at least a simple story in a complex context this is  simply  not good enough     the visuals are for the most part pretty good there are some good action scenes here and there the movie overall is mediocre but ok enough for the first hour and a half but the last hour takes it into the land of the unintended and unwillingly funny and not in a good way

firstly i do think this was a promising story i thought boutella was great as kora and most of the special effects were clean and looked great    however i think this film fell into the trap of following the sci fi epic cliches evil faction trying to take over the universe but being stopped by a unlikely band of rebels against the odds sound familiar and films that do that are never going to live up to star wars which is why they need to be a sci fi epic in their own right rather than leaning too heavily on these influences even down to naming one of the main warships of the motherworld the imperium dreadnought lets just say the movie wasnt the most original    i also feel the story was thin and slightly rushed and dialogue a little disjointed at times plus id like to have seen a bit more character development as well as background were thrown into this epic space story with a 2 minutes briefing of the history of this universe and absolutely no information on these characters when we meet them who they are where they come from what their story is the only character you could say developed and we found a little about was kora and the most promising character was one we see the least of jimmy unless you class ed skreins atticus giving a 10 second description of why each character hates the motherworld as background things did feel a little frantic on top of that occasionally some of the visuals were uneasy on the eye and hunhams accent i truly hope his character is dead so i dont have to hear his accent again in any upcoming rebel moon media     that being said it wasnt all bad and i am invested in seeing where the saga leads us and look forward to the sequel with anticipation the action sequences were a positive as they were well choreographed and the majority of acting and special effects were enjoyable as well i do want to see more of kora and see where her story arc goes plus how the motherworld reacts to the ending of part 1 despite the shortcomings there is something about the film pulling me back in for more     i perhaps was expecting a bit more of the wow factor and originality from the team behind the film and the budget behind them theyre not exactly amateurs room for improvement but if you are a lover of scifi and have a couple of hours free its worth a watch

nonononononononono  cheap copy pasta from every sci fi flick except poorly done  it even ends with a matrix like scene and i swear elon musk can sue because they used the term neuralink  it started with promise but then turned to boring cliche predictable absolute garbage  it just kept dragging on  its the plot of the magnificent seven except in space and poorly executed since the characters are boring and feel disposable  from space vikings to space nazis followed by space irish and space mexicans and the space indian then the space scotsman comes along  and they find the space jamaican and they go from space finland to space mexico   zero originality  youd swear it was max payne at times the way they liberally apply bullet time  they overdo the bullet time scenes  it makes you wanna vomit they slow everything down to try to make miniscule actions seem breathtaking and some scenes drag on for like 10 minutes and add nothing to the story  you literally wishing you could take the time you wasted watching it back  all the hype for this trash  pass please  youll thank me

some of the visuals were cool the movie feels like a dd session run by a 10 year old kid running for the first time without a clear story in mind but just grabbing scenes  encounters that he or she thought were cool from the different movies he or she has seen there was no character development no reason to care about any of the characters and nothing interesting happening in the story the movie should have a warning in the opening credits not to create a drinking game every time there is slow motion since that will certainly result in death by alcohol poisoning the villains in any scooby doo episode have far more depth and far more realistic motivations than the emp impe errr motherworld space baddies this was bad the only reason why i would give rebel moon an edge over awful last jedi is that at least rebel moon wasnt urinating on a franchise that i actually cared about this movie was not good

there are ingredients for an interesting story this isnt it the pros are mostly good visual effects and a good performance by ed skrein as the main villain unfortunately the script is more tell than show and the story is little more than a retelling of seven samurai in a blended star wars and warhammer skin with paper thin characters most of whom are entirely forgettable im not sure the promised extended version in the future can save this and its unfortunate that its even necessary for it carry that burden

i understand this is a part one but it spends the majority of its runtime assembling its cast of characters in the most basic way then they barely interact or speak it gives us nothing for us to care about this group the little we learn about them is in the form of a one sentence description delivered by the villain near the end all the while lacking in any kind of originality     the lead gets the most backstory told in flashbacks which sounds like a much more interesting story truthfully most of the characters seem to have their more interesting stories already behind them     there are some nice visuals here and there but it also looks ugly at times too theres a good action sequence early and thats where the film peaked for me the third act is a pretty standard shootout its fine for a film to have a small scale conflict but there was so little going on throughout the movie that it felt like nothing happened at all     ultimately we got a derivative movie nothingcharacters thin plot inconsistent visuals and an unsatisfying end very disappointing

theres nothing new to see here there are space vikings space samurai and space nazis and a group of them form a league in a quest for justice theres plenty of cgi and slow motion shots but the story is seemingly written by an ai that understands all the familiar tropes but isnt interested in any of the details

this movie is not an original concept and borrows heavily from multiple stories youve already seen but that doesnt mean it lacks entertainment  the story is compelling and the visuals are top notch  well worth a watch and im looking forward to more

maybe among the worst of 2023 and one of the most difficult films in recent years to fully watch till the end     story really bland and slowpaced maybe with part 2 some parts make more sense but as a movie alone  no   characters uninteresting ed skrein did a pretty decent job   visuals maybe the worst part of this one the awful use of dof and ridiculous amount of slowmo usage makes some scenes look very bad the film itself has a grim unappealing look with some nice scenes    i cant recommend this movie to anyone  it felt like a waste of time

meh wasnt bad wasnt amazing   if you are looking to be entertained for a couple hours its not a bad choice  but dont expect a new incredible epic either    the good  effects and visual quality were great top notch  cast is solid and interesting  fightaction choreography is decent    the meh  starts a bit slow gets a bit better though  characters are somewhat interesting but not well developed yet  not much interplay between characters they are just existing next to each other  acting is ok  unlike star wars avengers or even lotr little humor   that can be good or bad depending on what you are looking for im ok with it    the bad  completely cliche plot is nothing new or groundbreaking  suspend your disbeliefplot holes abound    the above two points are my only major criticismsbut they are huge   the plot is predictable totally unrealistic even for a space scifi fantasy movie   how are these individuals supposed to fight a huge empire and space shipswith their swords and a pistol    if the writingplot were greatly improved it would very cool  but for now its kinda just ok   not a waste of time if you like action and scifi but dont expect an epic   id compare it to feature length the expanse with better effects and choreography but less interesting and more cliche plot

i saw someone describe this as an rpg when you skip all the dialogue options and i feel like thats about the best description there could be theres no character development hell theres not really even any characters they hired some actors to immediately join the party without any personality or reason to care about them absolutely no depth at all the big betrayal doesnt matter because we havent gotten to know the characters enough for it to matter theres no chemistry between the characters so theres no emotion to it  the party is assembled on a bunch of planets were given no information about or reason to care about in a universe that short of some generic exposition we dont have any reason to care about  the action was poorly choreographed nonsense to the point the tiny steps people were taking running and awkward body posture when they knew things are going to be slowed down just looked ridiculous  the fights didnt flow and were the worst bad guy stands around and waits their turn possible  the story isnt just rushed its fractured and disjointed things just happen without any reason for them  i have no idea how this has as high rating as it does because this film is trash

a compelling setting with great visuals squandered by a cast of paperthin characters and a soulless story this movie attempts the classic seven samurai formula but fails to create compelling and likable characters the film casts character development and plot cohesion aside to squeeze in as much action as possible which might be a plus for some    if you are looking for a mindless action film that allows you to turn your brain off and marvel at the gorgeous setpieces and action sequences you will enjoy this film if you are looking for a compelling narrative with a cast of lovable characters you would be better off searching elsewhere

you know im a fan of many movies and many directors but most of all im a fan of good stories and good characters  this has both  sure there are some issues with battle scene slow motion which personally i think can detract from the chaos and intensity of battle but its a minor niggle if the story works its also refreshing to have a story not beset by a big studio message or pandering to be relevant in todays society and just being a story  its a traditional story about empire stomping on those that it claims to protect the things that real world rebellions have been caused by but its an enjoyable ride along with a band of characters and protagonists that left me wanting to see a the next chapter and b the extended rrated version

zack snider does it again   this movie was amazing i normally dont watch gritty scifi but i always want to give zack a look expecting the movie to be okay but i was surprised how engrossing the story is the characters the visuals and the settings top notch and the villain is one of the most scary and gross villains i had seen on a while the choice of weapon a blunt object makes him more sadistic and guttural very fresh way to present a villain in these sanitized times cant wait for the directors cut and the sequel

visually impressive and generally entertaining there was potential for this movie to be one of the best science fiction movies in a long time it started strong and had compelling characters but then it all started to feel rushed new characters were introduced like we already knew their backstoryand were immediately trusted by the protagonists without question there is an overwhelming star wars theme throughoutfrom the villain emerging from near death to bar scenes and the hero rising from a modest farming community what saves this movie is the visuals action sequences and there is nothing that is noticeably terrible like dialogue or massive plot holes it definitely would have benefited from pacing character development and a longer runtime they should made this into a limited series

an world and story full of potential but intrigue is lost when the it started to feel formulaic the start of the film had me interested in the world and kora the main character but as she goes on a venture to recruit an army it turns into a predictable structure of land on planet observe a character overcome a great feat and have them join the crew for no convincing reason this would have been a better format if done as a series with 810 episodes if each episode could have been spent on a planet exploring the lore culture races and laws of that world and making us care about the character thats eventually recruited it would have been way more impactful by the end of the season but rather when the big fight happens at the end of the film i had little to no investment into the characters at times i couldnt even recall their names therefore i have no reason to care who lives or dies i just simply watched it feeling next to nothing  it had good graphics but while the battle scenes look nice they cut into slow motion so often and at times that felt unneeded that it made the battles feel too long it also fell into the same trap that we see in action movies where no one despite being trained soldiers can aim their guns properly or hit their targets if their lives depended on it and yes their lives did depend on it of course our main character and her crew had exceedingly good luck with their aim s  thankfully the ending of the film left me intrigued and wanting to tune in for part 2 if only the middle of the film was as strong as the start and end it would be near perfect unfortunately the thought of sitting through this film a second time is not a thought ill be having anytime soon

the movie is long with very little character development while visually pretty at times they dont stay in any one place long enough for you to really explore the area the dialogue is laughable with one scene in particular the main character is trying to convince another person to join her team and the things she says are so bad i began laughing out loud as she spoke the lines it is a straight up remake of the seven samurai im not sure where the articles claiming its an original story get that idea from in seven samurai you have japanese farmers searching for samurai to defend their village from raiders stealing their rice in rebel moon you have space farmers searching for space warriors to defend their village from an empirial admiral stealing their wheat

what did i just watch hollywood directors need to go train in japan and learn how to create good films again the plot was boring and predictable the acting was sub par they really wasted the talent they had and the main character was just horrible just about everyone else in the film was more believable than her and had a better story arc very poorly executed project

this movie was kind of a mess the plot was paper thin which i mean is fine for a b sci fi flick but it was so choppy from the outset it didnt flow at all we start on a farm where we have our hero and possibly two unlikely allies that never show up again for whatever reason but were made to seem important yes im aware theres more parts but at least make it make sense the giant exposition dumps from our main heroin were bad go into the recruitment phase for this little adventure and it just felt like it just jumped from one planet to the next without truly fleshing out any of the characters for real so you didnt actually care why they were joining this crew the abilities they had to aid in this rebellion didnt really make any sense we had a farmer a grifter a wannabe anime female assassin type a retired drunken general and some random barbarian types because why not if i missed anyone else it was because they were just that forgettable all of the fight sequences save for one in the bar were awful typical stormtrooper fodder minus the fun the sad part is i found the background characters that had like one scene infinitely more interesting than the main cast a lot of slow mo when it wasnt necessary in fact in the final fight the slow motion made this big hero moment  of one of the characters look like he was straight out of team america world police that actually got a laugh out of me tldr it was a mess the characters sucked and if i didnt know that it was taking itself seriously i would have thought it was a parody

while rebel moon borrows from a lot of scifi tropes it really failed to deliver a compelling and riveting story visually this movie is a wonder to see and it has that warhammer 40k aesthetics to it however the execution of the story ruins it by giving us characters with no personalities and makes us believe that they would easily band together with very little effort it is unfortunate that this movie will heavily rely on the next chapter in order for it to be considered whole most movie series that are considered to be top tier have held their own with each movie each movie should have its own separate arc that will culminate at the conclusion sadly for this movie it will rely on the next installment scargiver for it to be considered digestible     the good visually amazing and i really love the concept    the bad execution of the movie is lackluster the pacing is terrible and the characters not interesting enough    the ugly overuse of slow motion not every action sequence needs a slow motion for the love of god zack stop it

yes theres plot holes character development issues and story beats thatseem to go nowhere but i still really enjoyed the film because for all of these negatives it also did so much right it gave us a rich unique universe ripe for exploration a well crafted mysterious competent main character that i want to keep following audio and visuals that a distinctly their own despite how many tropes and ideas were borrowed from other famous scifi stories like dune and the chronicles of riddick everyone is quick to say this film rips off star wars while seeming to forget that star wars was heavily inspired by flash gordon and dune    i admired the objectively good set design the stupendous score and the sense of curiosity about where the story is going to go and ya know whati think the audience score on rotten tomatoes is right 70 is completely fair this movie is without a doubt a 710 a flawed yet intriguing first entry into a new franchise that has room to blossom into something that could last for years to come or crumble under the weight of its own talented yet at times pretentious creator

well when watching its quite easy to see right off the bat why so many people are being critical of this film its definitely not without its flaws and there are several however from what ive heard theres to be an r rated directors cut being released next spring purportedly featuring an additional hour or so of extra content thats meant to fill in the majority of gaps in the character development and storyline issues that people keep complaining about     i agree with many on this point that although its technically a movie with 2 hour runtime it does feel seemingly rushed through but on the upside i thought the pacing moved along pretty swiftly throughout aka meaning i didnt find myself at all getting bored those 2 hours blew by and admittedly by the time the credits were rolling i was left feeling the desire to see more which isnt so bad since part ii is supposedly being released soonish    so me personally im eager to watch the directors cut despite an estimated runtime of 35 hours i believe the upcoming extended release version will potentially add on another 12 star to my initial rating due to it providing a sense of completeness to whatever seemed lacking from the first edit     in summary was this the absolute best scifi flick of the year that rivals the likes of the monolithic galaxies portrayed in star wars oh hell to the nobut was it something thats adequately entertaining dazzling to eyes and a fairly decent way to spend an evening passing some time yes yes i believe it is

rebel moon is definitely a good movie far from perfect but nowadays we should get our wins whenever we can    the story is simple perhaps a little too simple and it doesnt dodges the typical cliches seen in this genre of movies but we can see the potential of this world that zack synder has created    overall character performances were good and some even very good unfortunately the performance of the main character kora sophia boutella is not amongst them i had hoped she had grown more as an actress but it seems clear she will not be growing beyond what she has already shown in the past  and its a shame really seeing her character played perhaps by another actress like lets say emily blunt wouldve really shined and couldve perhaps been the creation of quite an important character within the scifi genre  i understand why sophia boutella was chosen for this role her dancing skills really come through in the action scenes but its her ability to show deeper levels of emotion that are lacking and for her character thats also a vital part    rebel moon hasnt done anything groundbreaking or revolutionary but its still a solid movie same as the story might seem too simplistic to some to others it seems to go over their heads some negative critics about it are not only unwarranted but a little petty as if they were expecting this movie to be what star wars or alien were in their beginning  when even star wars and alien cant reproduce their winning formula    dont go into this movie with too much expectations and will surprise you in a good way go into thinking it will be groundbreaking within the genre and youll obviously be disappointed  rebel moon has potential and its a good addition to the genre but it doesnt do anything that cant be expected from a good scifi movie and thats already quite an achievement considering how little in terms of good scifi movies we really get    at least rebel moon doesnt promise to shoot for the moon only to fall in a few meters

yes it is very cheesy in places but i really enjoyed it  i felt the first half was probably a bit slower than the rest but the ending had a far different pace  the action sequences were not bad that acting was good but man the script is  not so great  i get the feeling that part 2 might even things out more  just remember the original star wars had some terrible reviews and now is regarded as a true classic

of course its derivative we knew it was a gritty star wars meets  seven samurai but the execution is in general good the action is fun and the visuals dazzling the plot manages to do decent world building at a brisk pace keeping exposition to a minimum necessary letting its derivative natures fill on the gaps for the audience this first act is about assembling a team of interesting rogues giving them a thin mostly implicit backstory and setting up the second act their battle against unsurmountable odds to defend the little guy the acting is ok it lacks any memorable performances the climatic fight scene stretches logic a bit in true star wars style only the good guys have good aim and come out on top after being restrained and surrounded by enemy troops still it manages to be fun and exciting

rebel moon hit the hype train hard but missed the destination    spoiler its going pretty well a superb open narrative delivered by anthony hopkins its building our empathy right up to the point a villager is saved from sexual assault  its from this point on that it goes on its magnificent 7 quest that  well it becomes devoid of script any indication of amount of time passing        i can tell you theres a cora a general titus and some other people in it who dont like the status quo but you just dont really care to know because their back storys are delivered in perhaps 2 lines of script thats the core problem you just dont care about the charactersbecause you dont know them     a very personal issue is an aesthetic what the hell were they thinking with the primary antagonists hair cut no wonder hes more than a little narky every single reflective element in the world tells him he looks a right plonker    theres lots of borrowing from other scifi universes like 40k dune star wars firefly john carter but what we get served from this mixed dish is ever so slightly underwhelming it passes a few hours its mildly entertaining    over all youre left asking    what the hell is the mechanica military thing doing as the film closes

i enjoyed the movie i am looking forward to seeing the longer version     this was shot almost completely on green screen with cgi for pretty much everything     i agree it has overtones of many different ideas   nazis   vikings  amish  star wars  farscape  babylon 5  and much more     realize that considering the restrictions placed on him for the movie its better than i expected  i look forward to the next two movies and then the director cuts for all three which i suspect considering sniders other directors cuts will be even better     give it a chance and realize if your looking for award winning movie this is not it   if your looking for an enjoyable movie that is definitely different and is trying to do much more with a lot less like farscape and babylon 5 then i suspect you may enjoy this
