it was a good movie great cast and action sure it has its faults lots of plot armor for main characters and some inexplicable moments in general but id like to see more of this universe very much warhammer 40k meets star wars awesome designs for ships armor weapons and planets needs to be fleshed out more but this was a good start strong female lead not some damsel in distress the whole cast needs to be more expressive though i know now they are trying to be under the radar but it would be better to see them being more active backstory would have been a better place to start for the main and some support characters but a fun watch nonetheless and a visual treat i would have like to see more from jimmy but i guess most of that was cut   i hope they spend more time laying out the history of this galaxy and maybe why the king was slain to put things into perspective it seems like there was so much more that led into this situation in the film that was not expounded upon that it becomes muddled was the original empire good or bad what was the struggle initially i have a lot of questions but hopefully they can be answered in the future in filmseries formats comic tieins seem lazy to me for exposition do a book if needed

good cast interesting premise no expenses spared with cgi and costume design but by the end of the 2 hour run time it all collapses under the weight of a poor screenplay  felt like a film student project that just ripped off existing movies and tried to cram so many things into two hours at the expense of any character or world building beyond a few lines of cheap exposition    it started out okay then started to feel bad and by the end i felt angry at giving up two hours of my life while at the same time i found myself laughing at how bad the last line uttered in the movie was    i enjoyed reading reviews of people thrashing this movie more than the movie itself at least

idk whats up with the rt score being 21 from starting off at a 9 thats kinda insane i thought this movie was awesome the story is a classic seven samuraiknights of the round table kind of team up movie to protect the planet veldt kora and gunnar set off in search of help and it takes off from there the pacing is a bit off in the middle of the movie and i feel like a lot of the extended cut will show what we missed out on but the first and third acts are the strongest the visuals were out of fucking hand the flashback scene when kora dives into her past was one of the best and i was just in awe of how this movie looked al there were establishing shots that were as epic as some in lord of the rings at times it felt inspired by a cronenberg movie with the alien and technology infused aliens jimmy the robot was also a great character and i cant wait to see what the extended rated r cut will show as well as part ii  the scargiver also not to forget is the sets costumes props vehicles were awesome junkie xls score complimented the movie so well and hit just right when it needed to i suggest watching and deciding for yourself but i think its a good movie with plenty of rewatchability

a somewhat middling movie it took a big shot and i felt it missed the net for the most part it tries to set up an appealing universe without providing nearly enough context or information there are a number of characters who just seem to do things not because they make sense but because the script wants them to     while visually pretty i feel like there was an over reliance on slow motion effects that took away from the film among other odd visual choices the main one that stood out to me involved a fight breaking out after a young girl is threatened with sa where there was a decent amount of unpleasantness surrounding what happens to the girl on screen to then transition to a fight scene involving axes and knives with not a single bit of blood nor wounds in sight     just an odd film that felt like it had certain points on a checklist it had to hit but not much else to it

i think the idea of a critic has been lost surely a critic should judge anm movie so the potential audience can make an educated decision on whether to watch a movie based on an expert opinion but im seeing more and more disparity between audience scores and critic scores  if the two metrics are so far apart what is the point in the critic theyre obviously completely unaware of what the audience wants and basing their opinion on some other measure of entertainability   im starting to think that the critics are solely looking for artyfarty deep and meaningful artistic socially  real world questioning films which are inherently boring frustrating and completely missing the objective of cinema which is to escape the real world for 90 minutes not to be reminded of lifes stuggles and leave the cinema less depressed than when we arrive

story 05  acting 05  special effects 25  overall    this is gobots trying to be starwars   the story is a straightforward copy of battle for the planets without the charm so derivative to a level i have never witnessed  the acting is as good as the willow tv show   the special effects were passable   i applaud the attempt to make a new scifi universe but this an example of why directors should not try to write movies or shows   it also proves that spending the most money doesnt guarantee good quality  i personally just didnt enjoy this i hope you do and if you do thats great   for the record 300 is one of my favourite films because it was basically a direct translation of the amazing work of frank millar  i enjoyed the jlsc  but this was just a big miss for me

rebel moon part 1 is damned amazing akira kurosawa would be proud hint so first off i am old enough to have seen the first star wars commercial trailer on a 1977 panasonic tv and then see the movie 12 times in a row in waikiki in 1977 since then i spent 30 years in the marines fighting 2 actual wars been to every con and still ticking the negative reviewers can go swallow a light saber blind   the story line in rebel moon and the characters are all familiar going back to decades of other parables but the way rm weaves the narratives given the time and pacing available is newand freshly unfamiliar as the epic scenery and graphical style it frickin drips with molten awesomeness the slow mo shoot outs are like dead eye from red dead but better the blasters and sabers are reinvented the protagonist kora   hello tron and last avatar is a believable sleeper bad ass chic ala vazquez in aliens gen titus in a gladiator stadium wanting to die with honor  hell yes ptsd for a flag officer maximus salutes you siragain i could go on but why just watched with my 3 kids and hell gonna watch again tonight with sub woofers on kill thank you zach snyder semper fi mf

soooo lets start one they arent space nazis they are just nazis in space the cgi starts out great first world looks awesome but in my opinion the visuals fade very quickly after leaving the ssssssssssssssslllllllooooooooooo mmmmmmmooooooooo is everywhere they are farming in slow mo slow mo doesnt make things more important or better now my second huge gripe is the constant fucking exposition dumps jesus they are nearly constant 12 in every arc you can show or tell zs does both bold move but you cant do it 9 times now great plot idea to build a team but for me the team is too big smaller team would help us care more about the charters so when things happen we can really feel the outcomes also lets talk about the leading lady looks great but i have trouble really connecting to her she feels very forced and i think maybe the directors cut can bridge this gap but why release it the visuals are great i suggest watching it in theaters or make it as cinematic as possible think felt more like a what you missed catch up to a tv series very episodic continuity was an issue for me which brings me to pacing which wasnt very good maybe the directors cut can save it and really make it resonate with me for now i want to give it a 5710 for the fact its a new ip for zs i will say a 6210

due to the audacious marketing that this was the next star wars it was automatically held up on a high pedestal thats something that you need to allow your audience to proclaim not your lackey marketing goblins it took me awhile to separate myself from that and just look at it as it was     it was fine it was certainly visual and it had some genre panache at times it felt like they threw every successful scifi franchise in an ai blender and said cook the characters were interesting enough i just hardly know much about any of them outside of kora there wasnt much character development sure each of this sci fi fellowship can handle their own but thats not who they are to their core when big things start happening in the story i just shrugged they are still strangers to me and the danger is very low stakes all very frustrating as we have the capacity for deep story telling with the glimmer of mythology from the princess issa story thats basically as deep as it gets     the third act definitely felt rushed and very sudden not in a fun aha gotcha way kinda like they were assessing that they needed to end and decided to end by doing so they put in a beat where they killed the weight of some of the important setup by the narrator at the beginning jist cast it aside with no consequences overall making the payoff a bit hollow     heres hoping pt 2 paves the way more thoughtfully     all a shame

it was pitched as a star wars film and you can see that literally taking many things from it with little difference including scenes    the characters are very one dimensional with little reason to like any of them and there are far too many for what is a 2 part film duo i struggle to think part 2 will get you invested in any of them     each character is quickly glossed over and makes it feel like how the star wars sequel trilogy felt in terms of character development non existent any background of the main character of which i do not even know her name is told in the form of her talking over a flashback instead of showing these events really unfold    slow motion is beyond egregious sure it looks pretty but its over used so much it makes the scenes where its used well less impactful because im seeing it constantly    it is just another mediocre film that feels like a really bad star wars rip off sadly    the villain guy is slightly compelling and im more interested in his story tbh    i dont think a part 2 will save the shallowness of this film

rebel moon part one was a bit of a letdown for me i had heard that this was originally a pitch for a star wars movie but i went in with certain expectations i was imagining a slightly grittier version of star wars and instead it was a mashup of stereotypical scifi tropes and far too much slowmotion action     the theming of the movie was all over the place as well it appeared that they were trying to go with a sort of romaninspired theming for the main antagonists however it was done in a way that felt very much like several other large scifi franchises there were also themes of westerns and samuraininja theming in there as well and they didnt find a way to blend them successfully in my opinion on the same planet there was also a village that was of a northern european style akin to viking culture and they rode their animals a day ride to a town and it was essentially a futuristic mashup of a wild west town no two places seemed to be connected in this universe with everything having such vastly different design languages    aside from the failed theming of the film i had some serious issues with pacing as well when the protagonists were traveling there was no time between their previous encounters and the new they would be on the ground about to leave and then immediately in another area about to meet with the person they were looking for there was no buildup in meeting any of the individuals they were looking for and there was no real reason that they were making any of the stops in the first place it wasnt revealed until nearly the end of the film why they had been picking up particular individuals and the twist in the story was seen for a long time coming again with the timing being so odd nearly all of the action in this is of the slowmotion variety while i dont have anything against that in itself when you watch the same people moving very slowly for about 5 minutes in what could have been a 30second encounter you start to get a bit bored    i also have some issues with the story itself however i wont spoil that here ill just say that the only characters that i was truly invested in either died after being on screen for a few minutes or had a very minor role in the film i wasnt able to find a good connection to any of the main cast as all of their characters were truly unlikable except for the farmer every other main character had some element to them that made them feel as though they could be disposable and that i wouldnt mind if they died in the film    the story of rebel moon was a bit too much thrown in your face the audience wasnt allowed to see the story unfold as there was far too much of the story that was told a common theme in great films is to make the story seen not told rebel moon failed miserably at that     one area that this film shines through is its effects i thought that they looked quite good there is a robot character that shows up quite early in the film and it looks fantastic its not all good though as many of the aliens in the film look like they took a person and altered them slightly none of them apart from one in my opinion look rather good they seem to be just costumed people with rubber faces there were no unique alien ideas again aside from one that used another person to talk for them    overall if you are interested in cheesy scifi and dont mind a halfbaked story then go ahead and watch this if however you dont like the overtroped scifi and slowmotion messes stay away its not for you

completely raw thoughts as i watch premise is 7 samurai  dune  star wars the village and villagers are as naive and ignorant as the ones in 7 samurai the motherworld army  space nazis actually more like space soviets are ruthless as the empires  first orders troopers replace the protagonists of star wars with 7 samurai replace 12 the plot of star wars with 7 samurai instead of a death star and farm boy becoming a jedi its farmers and outcasts vs space warmongers ngl i also see some references to like clash of the titans when tarak tarzan duh side note dude looks like he could pull off as tarzan was riding the bennu similary to how perseus was riding pegasus dunno why this movie also gives me warhammer vibes probably the outfits and weapons also gives me bungie games vibes especially d2 from how some of the lore is presented some of the cg scenes kinda feels like game cutscenes or sortta like cg from tron but thats fair enough considering tech advances and budget some of the movements and skills tbh im fine with slomo scenes in films i feel like there were some moments where its unecessary or a little too much love the twist with kai side note rewatch 7 samurai if there was ever a betrayal like this last battle between kora and noble reminds me of rogue one the scene when all 6 of them were sidebyside was for sure a call back to zsjl  jl ending where the 6 were together noble definitly got darth vader treatment at the end 2nd chance at life by his master cant wait to see the threat hell become next scoring is great overall for context 7 samurai was like 3 and 12 hours long so this film would ofc feel incomplete without its part 2 since the premise is pretty much 7 samurai overall id say it was a good film if the cut  r version is better when it releases ill revisit scoring

zack snider is like a music video director and i will explain    he is not in the service of the story what he does is try to create cinematic moments but he cant mix his attempts at continus cinematic moments in the editing room as none of them match each other in tones colors or ambiences  it worked great in 300 as he only had 1 storyline to tell but as soon as you add a second one it becomes harder             if you watch a kpop or rap music video and you have people dancing to it most of the time these people cant dance pretty well so they make cuts like in a fight scene where people cant really fight to present them in their best light and here is where it bogs down    the lighting for all these scenes never has any continuity as the scenes lighting is reset to regive the best light for the next cut of that scene there is no shadow game to emphasize the story telling and what you are getting is a picture that moves instead of a scene  if you look carefully at the different angles of camera happening in the same scene you will notice that the shadows are not in the same place on the actors and the sets behind them as the scene goes on      now if you take that moving picture and use a volume screen green screen or cgi the lighting that is already not working is really not working in the completed scene as the entire lighting isnt matching and that give you that feeling of coldness which is now the trademark of snider          that blue or redorange hue that he is known for isnt a signature skill its what happens when you desaturate reduce exposure and crank the contrast up in your video editing software to hide imperfections in your footage    speaking of color grading in this movie its all over the place you will notice that we jump from an orange hue in one scene to a blue hue then to a classic cinematic hue in an other without any reasons for it   in movie making the use of these hues are there to emphasize the mood of a scene or a story line it could be also used to differentiate locations but in this movie the changes are done for no apparent reasons and sometimes in the same fucking scene     this is why besides the script and the acting this movie is unwatchable there is no redeeming qualities to it    if you take other snider movies they all had redeeming quality   in 300 the script was garbage but the visuals saved the movie cinematic moments  in man of steel the script wasnt great but the visuals until the final fight scene saved the movie plus its fucking superman cinematic moments  in the watchmen the script saved the rebel moon part 1 has taken the world of storytelling to unprecedented heights brace yourself for an unforgettable experience crafted with an unimaginably incredible storyline and breathtaking visuals that will leave you at the edge of your seat    the first thing that strikes you about rebel moon is its mindblowing plot this captivating tale transcends the boundaries of traditional storytelling expertly blending together elements of science fiction adventure and intrigue that seamlessly draw you in from the very first scene the depth of the characters their development and the intricate web of relationships they navigate are nothing short of enchanting    throughout this thrilling narrative rebel moon introduces us to a richly detailed world which successfully transports us to a reality painted with visual genius the visual effects in this film are nextlevel stunning leaving the viewers spellbound from the aweinspiring landscapes to the meticulously crafted spaceships and futuristic technologies each frame is a visual feast for the eyes leaving us in awe of the sheer beauty and creativity on display    the exceptional cinematography and attention to detail further enhance the storytelling experience the brilliant use of varying camera angles and perfect lighting helps to create a sense of intensity and suspense allowing us to uncover hidden aspects of the story with each passing moment it truly feels as if we are right there immersed in every twist and turn of rebel moons epic adventure    moreover the exceptional performances of the cast bring the story to life in an unforgettable way the actors dedication and skill captivate the audience as their talents give birth to multidimensional characters that we cant help but cheer for or empathize with their chemistry and the emotional connections they convey further elevate the impact of the alreadycompelling narrative    rebel moon part 1 is a rare gem that defies expectations and redefines the boundaries of modern storytelling it showcases the magic that can be achieved when a remarkable story plot meets breathtaking visuals and stellar performances this film is a true celebration of artistic brilliance and innovation setting new standards in the world of cinema    prepare yourself for an unparalleled journey that will leave you craving for more rebel moon part 1 is an absolute mustwatch that will undoubtedly leave a lasting mark on both casual viewers and avid fans of science fiction dont hesitate to immerse yourself in this astounding adventure

i loved this movie  while many people are complaining and calling this a star wars rip off i would have to disagree i loved all the nods to other films and the little snippets here and there from other films such as star wars dune harry potter and probably so many more i honestly look forward to watching it again and seeing what other pieces have been so obviously loved by the writers that they put these things into this film they have taken things that have been done before just like any other writer and film maker and spun it into something of their own while creating something new and mesmerizing i would of liked to of seen a little more characterization and build up to the extra characters that were being recruited in the film as i dont feel much level of attachment to them i felt more attachment to the spider lady with her little speech about the mines and what has been done to her i felt more   for her than a recruited good guy but overall i really liked this film a little bit of the cgi looked goofy in a few spots particularly a flying animal scene but i can overlook that i am very happy to see more scifi fantasy being made i look forward to the next installment

i was lucky to catch a preview screening i expected to see a copy of star wars but what i saw wasnt star wars it was much bigger the director created a living world from scratch we feel its enormity we meet a multitude of characters each of whom has their own story and role in this galaxy this is no longer the sterile and colorful scifi that disney gives us but a fullfledged cosmic dark fantasy a production that exceeds the expectations of modern audiences and gives something more  visually musically acted narratively in every respect rebel moon shines and i have no doubt that for many of you it will be the best production of this year if not the decade this film simply must be watched  maybe during the first viewing you will be a bit overwhelmed by the pace at which the story is presented but during the second viewing when you know what this production is about you will appreciate this film even more really watch this before someone will spoil you this masterpiece

zach snyders star wars coughs i mean rebel moon this is a good scifi film its got elements of genre blending elements of a viking norse epic a western seven samurai the magnificent seven and zacks version of star wars this isnt the same thing as star wars it has a different vibe it is a quality scifi film with a good mature story it has an epic score two times i could picture darth vader coming into the next scene based upon the audio design the visuals are great the story is great i took a road trip to the bay theater to see this in theaters and im glad i did i really liked it i want to see the r rated version it feels like some important elements of the story could be expanded upon there are hints that a sex scene may have been cut overall i like the tone the visual style and the audio design i wish it was available in a larger theater the small theater  screen didnt show it in the size and scale i would have preferred to see this needs to be shown on the larger screens to a mass audience this is a solid franchise starter its a quality movie i wish it was available in more theaters and on larger screens as it deserves this should have been a wider release i am glad i took the road trip to see it in theaters i can wait to see the full r rated version of the film

rebel moon a story that tells a tale of a former soldier known as kora that ran off from tyrannical empire to live peacefully at a small moon called veldt until admiral atticus noble lands on the planet and the quest to find rebels that willing to join them to save the whole universe    what do i think of rebel moon      the film itself ranging from visuals spectacle to its world building it was phenomenal zack knows what hes doing from the ground up personally for me its already ten times better than star wars content for the past 20 years this should be watch on the biggest screen and on imax for sure how good the visuals is and for the story and characters all set well and done every character is a definite show stealer especially kora and kai both of them are badassess the side characters also did and serve their purpose to the story while i have small gripes i would say that the story should be more fleshed out and they could just add up around 20 minutes more to the film so that it can breathe and seen more characters clild shine throughout     all and all rebel moon is by far one of the best action films in 2023 dont forget to check it out
